input_text:
Job Title: Senior Technologist - Exploratory and Innovation,

Location: Plymouth, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Vantive: A New Company Built On Our Legacy

Baxter is on a journey to separate our ~$5B Kidney Care segment into a standalone company. Vantive* will build on our nearly 70-year legacy in acute therapies and home and in-center dialysis to provide best-in-class care to the people we serve. We believe Vantive will not only build our leadership in the kidney care space, it will also offer meaningful work to those who join us.

At Vantive, you will become part of a community of people who are focused, courageous and don’t settle for the mediocre. Each of us are driven to help improve patients’ lives worldwide. Join us as we revolutionize kidney care and other vital organ support.

Completion of the proposed separation of Kidney Care from Baxter into a standalone company (to be named Vantive) remains subject to the satisfaction of customary conditions.

Your Role

As a Senior Technologist of Exploratory and Innovation, you will lead and contribute to the identification and early-stage development of new novel approaches to the treatment of kidney disease. In this role, you will play a key role in supporting the design, development, and testing of complex electromechanical systems for medical applications, including the creation of test rigs, test measurement systems, and execution of comprehensive testing and analysis activities.

What You'll Be Doing

Test System Development: Design, build, and maintain test rigs and fixtures for evaluating electromechanical and sensing systems, ensuring accuracy, repeatability, and reliability of test setups.Test Measurement Systems: Develop and implement test measurement systems, including sensors, data acquisition systems, instrumentation, and control systems, to collect and analyze performance data.Testing and Analysis: Execute complex testing protocols and procedures to evaluate the performance, functionality, and reliability of electromechanical and sensing systems, including mechanical, electrical, and software components.Data Analysis: Analyze test data using appropriate tools and techniques, including statistical analysis, signal processing, and data visualization, to draw meaningful conclusions and identify areas for improvement.Troubleshooting: Identify and troubleshoot issues and anomalies during testing and provide recommendations for resolution, working closely with engineering teams to implement corrective actions.Documentation: Maintain detailed documentation of test procedures, results, observations, and recommendations, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and quality standards.Calibration and Maintenance: Perform calibration, maintenance, and repair of test equipment and instrumentation to ensure accuracy and reliability of test measurements.Collaboration: Collaborate with engineers, scientists, and other technical contributors to support product development activities, provide technical expertise, and contribute to the achievement of project milestones and objectives.Continuous Improvement: Participate in continuous improvement initiatives to enhance testing processes, methodologies, and capabilities, driving efficiency, quality, and innovation.Safety: Adhere to safety protocols and guidelines to maintain a safe working environment and ensure compliance with relevant regulations and standards.

What You'll Bring

Associate degree or equivalent technical certification in Electrical Engineering Technology, Mechanical Engineering Technology, or related field; Bachelor's degree preferred.Minimum of 10 years of experience in a technical role specializing in electromechanical and sensing systems, preferably in the medical device or healthcare industry.Experience with computer-aided design software such as Creo and/or Solid Works, and translating these designs into physical prototypes leveraging traditional machining and rapid prototyping.Proficiency in the design, assembly, and operation of electromechanical test rigs and measurement systems.Strong hands-on experience with instrumentation, data acquisition systems, sensors, actuators, and control systems.Demonstrated ability to execute complex testing protocols and analyze test data using relevant software tools (e.g., LabVIEW, MATLAB, Python).Excellent troubleshooting skills and attention to detail, with the ability to identify and resolve technical issues effectively.Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.Familiarity with regulatory requirements and quality standards for medical devices (e.g., FDA, ISO) preferred.Commitment to safety, quality, and continuous improvement in all aspects of work.

We understand compensation is an important factor as you consider the next step in your career. At Baxter, we are committed to equitable pay for all our employees, and we strive to be more transparent with our pay practices. To that end, this position has a base salary range of $72,000 to $99,000 plus an annual incentive bonus and equity target. The above range represents the expected base salary range for this position. The actual salary may vary based upon several factors including, but not limited to, relevant skills/experience, time in the role, business line, and geographic/office location.

The successful candidate for this job may be required to verify that he or she has been vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to reasonable accommodations for individuals with medical conditions or religious beliefs that prevent vaccination, and in accordance with applicable law.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Baxter is an equal opportunity employer. Baxter evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.

EEO is the Law

EEO is the law - Poster Supplement

Pay Transparency Policy

Reasonable Accommodations

Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.

Recruitment Fraud Notice

Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

129530

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
